summary: A photo-sharing app called 'Devil India' similar to Instagram with image posting, likes/comments, follow/unfollow, user profiles, feed, and authentication. The app should have its own distinct identity (not look like Instagram), use a blue color scheme, and include Stories, Explore/Search, Notifications, and Save/Bookmark features.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication so users can sign in and out securely. Gate all social features (posting, liking, commenting, following) behind authentication.
Implement user profiles stored in the backend. Each profile has a principal-based ID, a display name, a bio, and an avatar URL. Users can edit their own profile.
Implement image post creation. Authenticated users can create a post by providing an image URL and a caption. Posts are stored in the backend with a timestamp and the author's principal.
Implement a home feed that displays posts from users the current authenticated user follows, sorted by most recent. If the user follows nobody, show a discovery feed with all recent posts.
Implement a like system. Authenticated users can like or unlike any post. The like count is stored in the backend per post.
Implement a comment system. Authenticated users can add text comments to any post. Comments are stored in the backend with author principal and timestamp.
Implement follow/unfollow. Authenticated users can follow or unfollow other users. The follower and following counts are stored in the backend.

Apply a bold, modern visual theme. Use a dark charcoal background (#111111 / #1a1a1a) with warm amber/gold accent colors (#F5A623), clean sans-serif typography, card-based layouts with subtle shadows, and smooth hover transitions. Enforce this theme consistently across all pages and components.

Render the generated static assets (app logo and placeholder avatar) from frontend/public/assets/generated in the UI: the logo in the top navigation bar and the placeholder avatar for users who have not set a custom avatar URL.

Update the visual theme across the entire app to use a deep navy/blue color scheme (e.g., primary background #0d1117 / #0f1923, accent color #2563EB or a vivid electric blue #3B82F6) replacing the current amber/gold accents. Update Tailwind config, CSS custom properties, and all component styling to consistently apply the new blue palette while keeping the dark charcoal base and card-based layout.

Implement a Stories feature. Authenticated users can create a Story by providing an image URL; stories are stored in the backend with a 24-hour TTL (timestamp-based expiry checked on read). The home page displays a horizontal scrollable Stories bar at the top showing avatars of users who have active stories. Clicking a story avatar opens a full-screen story viewer overlay. Stories expire after 24 hours and are not returned by the backend after expiry.

Implement an Explore/Search page. Add a new route '/explore'. The page shows a search input at the top; users can search for other users by display name. Below the search, display a grid of all recent posts (discovery feed). Backend should expose a searchUsers query that returns profiles matching a display name substring.

Implement a Notifications system. The backend should record notification events for: a user's post being liked, a user's post receiving a new comment, and a user being followed. Each notification stores the actor's principal, the event type, the target post ID (if applicable), and a timestamp. Expose a getNotifications query returning the caller's notifications sorted by most recent, and a markNotificationsRead update call. Add a Notifications page at '/notifications' and a bell icon in the navigation bar with an unread badge count.

Implement a Save/Bookmark feature. Authenticated users can bookmark or unbookmark any post. The backend stores a per-user set of saved post IDs and exposes savePost, unsavePost, and getSavedPosts calls. Add a bookmark icon button on each PostCard. Add a '/saved' page that displays the authenticated user's saved posts in a grid.

Update the navigation bar to include links to the new Explore ('/explore'), Notifications ('/notifications'), and Saved ('/saved') pages. The bell icon should show an unread notification badge. All new nav items should follow the existing navigation styling with the updated blue theme.

Ensure the app name 'Devel' is used consistently across all user-facing text, page titles, meta tags, and branding elements. Remove any references to 'Insta Clone', 'Instagram Clone', or similar placeholder names. Update the HTML <title> in index.html, the landing page hero text, the navigation bar logo/wordmark, the profile setup modal, and any other location that displays the app name.

Rename the app from 'Devel' to 'Devil India' consistently across all user-facing text, page titles, meta tags, and branding elements. Update the HTML <title> in index.html, the landing page hero text and footer, the navigation bar logo/wordmark, the profile setup modal, and any other location that currently displays 'Devel'.
